procsynth.shine3.engine

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • procsynth.shine3.engine.Block
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    And, DummyAbstract, DummyFinal, DummyModule, DummyShine, Hertz, Not, Or

    public class Block
extends Object
    A Block is a piece of program that has inputs and outputs. Blocks can by wired together through their inputs and outputs to form a complex tree program. Each block keeps a list of which of its inputs are connected to which other block's outputs.
    The Blocks subclasses are automatically discovered at runtime by looking in the classpath.
    To be available to use in Shine the class has to extends this class or any subclasses and to be declared final.
    To implement the block functionality you write a subclass that override the constructor and the tick() method. The tick method is executed by the engine at each loop after all of its inputs blocks have been ticked in order to have the freshest input values.
    In the constructor you can set up the input and the outputs of the block using newInput(java.lang.String, T) and newOutput(java.lang.String, T).
    You retrieve the values of the inputs using the get(java.lang.String) method and set the values of the outputs using set(java.lang.String, T).

    A simple subclass: 

            public final class Echo extends Block{

                public Echo(){
                        newInput("ear", "");
                        newOutput("mouth", "");
                }
 
                public void tick(){
                        String heard = "I heard: " + (String) get("ear");
                        System.out.println(heard);
                        set("mouth", heard);    
                }
        }
    Since:
    v0.0.1
    Author:
    procsynth - Antoine Pintout
    See Also:
    BlockEngine, BlockFactory

      • generateBlockIdString

        private String generateBlockIdString()
        Generate a unique string that will be used to reconstruct the block objet when needed. It's structure is: {fully qualified classname of block class of blockFactory class}:{uniqueid string}
        Returns:
        the id string
